p: We focus on two particular study cases: (A) typical influenza epidemics, with initial reproductive number R 0 = 1.5, solar-pump efficiencies ε = 1 and 0 (i.e. no solar pump) and recovery and death rate γ out = 0.2 and μ = 0.001, respectively, and (B) a more aggressive and higher mortality epidemics, with parameters similar to those recorded for the recent SARS-Cov-2 pandemic (R 0 = 3, γ out = 0.1 and μ = 0.01) and solar efficiencies ε = 1, 0.3, and 0. For each case, we consider three different LOI rates: γ in = 0 (i.e. no LOI), γ in = 0.0055 (180-day period: shorter than seasonality), and γ in = 0.00055 (5-year period: much longer than seasonality).
